summary: Sari Mordana was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in the HSCA staff payroll records. The Assassination Records Review Board postponed the release of her Social Security number from these records in 1995 due to privacy concerns. Documents related to her employment include payroll authorization forms, leave records, and correspondence.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Sari Mordana's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the specific nature of her role within the HSCA is not detailed in the provided documents, her inclusion in payroll records and the privacy concerns surrounding her Social Security number indicate her involvement in the committee's operations. The postponement of the release of her Social Security number by the Assassination Records Review Board highlights the sensitivity of information related to HSCA staff.
